clue: Article about charmingly old-fashioned leaderless dance, representing friendship
explanation: Article (A) about (C as in circa) charmingly old-fashioned (QUAINT) leaderless dance (ANCE), representing "friendship" = ACQUAINTANCE.
hints: "Leaderless" implies getting rid of the first letter of a word!
A charmingly old-fashioned leaderless dance, on New Year's Eve? The whole clue is a reference to Auld Lang Syne! Does that help?
What's a single word that means "charmingly old-fashioned"?
"Article" in a clue often tells us that the answer will contain A, AN, or THE.
"About" can be represented by C, meaning circa.
